intro: Cacalia brachycoma, commonly known as the short-horned bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Cacalia brachycoma is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
